The Randolph Public School Nurses will be hosting a medication return for families on May 12 from 9am-12pm. If you have medication to pick up, please come to your student's school within that time frame and:

Pull up to the main entry door for the building.

Please REMAIN IN YOUR CAR. Your school nurse will come to you.

Please note, no one will be permitted to enter the school building for any reason.

Place your family's name in the car window that faces the school. Write the student's last name and first initial in large, dark lettering on a piece of paper and hold it up so the nurse knows whose medication to bring out.

The nurse will hand you your student's medication in a clear bag, maintaining social distance.

Before you drive away please verify you have the correct medication.

If you have questions or need to communicate with your school nurse, please email prior to May 12 so that we can maintain social distancing and keep people moving.

February 27 at 4:42 PM ·

We have had a few reports today of residents receiving calls from “The Town of Randolph” and asking for personal information. This is a scam call and residents should NEVER give any personal information (Social Security Number, bank account information, Etc...) to anyone over the phone unless you can verify the the call is legitimate. The Town of Randolph will never call asking for this information.

In addition, residents have reported the number the calls are coming from is the number to Randolph High School. This is known as a “phishing scam” where criminals will use legitimate phone numbers to try and scam people. Unless you are expecting a call from the High School residents are advised to not answer their phone and let the call go to voicemail.
